Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the amount of political donations given by big Wall Street banks and corporations to Democrats compared to Republicans.
Understate: The claim understates the political contributions from Wall Street and corporations favoring Republicans.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not providing enough evidence or support for the assertion that Democrats receive "many times more" political donations.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the statement that Democrats receive significantly more political donations than Republicans.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the size of political donations directly correlates with the favorability of Wall Street banks and corporations towards Democrats.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that big business and big government work together in a symbiotic relationship, rather than big business favoring Democrats over Republicans.
